body_html:
Closing this issue since it appears to be due to following a tutorial which advocates building from live head of the git repo (despite the URL saying how-to-install-gpu-tensorflow-0-9-from-sources-ubuntu-14-04)

This command will pick up the current state of the github repository, rather than a specific known working version:
git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow

Though we make every effort to test each commit, some issues will inevitable slip through, so it is usually much safer to install a working binary package or at least build from source using a specific tagged version.

As @tatatodd says, a fix for the particular error is in progress here #8039

This command will pick up the current state of the github repository, rather than a specific known working version:
git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow
Though we make every effort to test each commit, some issues will inevitable slip through, so it is usually much safer to install a working binary package or at least build from source using a specific tagged version.
As @tatatodd says, a fix for the particular error is in progress here #8039
body:
Closing this issue since it appears to be due to following a tutorial which advocates building from live head of the git repo (despite the URL saying `how-to-install-gpu-tensorflow-0-9-from-sources-ubuntu-14-04`)

This command will pick up the current state of the github repository, rather than a specific known working version:
`git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow`

Though we make every effort to test each commit, some issues will inevitable slip through, so it is usually much safer to install a working binary package or at least build from source using a specific tagged version.
 
As @tatatodd says, a fix for the particular error is in progress here https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/8039
